title: Wilfried Zaha hits back at Gareth Southgate's claims he lacked the passion to play for England
text:
Wilfried Zaha hits back at Gareth Southgate's claims he lacked the passion to play for England "Wilf's ‘desire’ or ‘passion’ should never have been publicly questioned for making that decision," said his agent Share Zaha has hit back at England boss Gareth Southgate for questioning his passion (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Crystal Palace star Wilfried Zaha has hit back at Gareth Southgate's claims he didn't have the passion needed to play for England. 
The Eagles winger got tired of waiting for a call-up to the Three Lions and in November decided to play for the Ivory Coast, how country of birth, instead. 
And on Tuesday Southgate claimed Zaha was the first player he asked to play for him after becoming England boss not long after, but the 24-year-old winger's mind was already made up. 
However Southgate added that "if you don’t feel that 100 per cent passion of playing for England, then I’m not sure it’s for me to sell that to you" which prompted a fierce reply from Zaha's agent Will Sathouse. 
He said: “The ‘private’ meeting with Mr Southgate was very amicable. Read More Wilfried Zaha is Crystal Palace's Eden Hazard says Sam Allardyce Zaha has been Palace's best player for the past 18 months (Photo: PA) Wilf has already played six times and scored twice for the Ivory Coast since November (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Read More Wilfried Zaha channels Lionel Messi to score the goal of his life in Ivory Coast's 2-0 win over Russia 
“However, the fact remains that Wilfried made his decision to play for the Ivory Coast prior to Mr Southgate being appointed interim and subsequently permanent England manager. 
“It was Wilfried’s personal choice and it was his right as a senior player to accept the opportunity to represent his nation of birth and that of his family heritage. 
“His ‘desire’ or ‘passion’ should never have been publicly questioned for making that decision." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
